resources.string: Press the add (+)\nbutton to get started!
Manufacturer claims of the balance point are often incorrect and are altered depending upon modifications to racquet such as new grips, different strings, etc.

In order to determine the balance point of your racquet, lie a racquet on a table or countertop with the stringed head portion of the racquet hanging off the edge. Slowly slide the racquet until it reaches a balancing point where it is about to fall off. Mark this point and measure from the bottom of the racquet.
